Narva mnt 18
51009 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Methods of statistical analysis broadly classified as supervised and unsupervised learning are treated. Though many methods belonging here come from the history of statistics, significant contribution has been made by algorithmic methods of computer scientists during last years. The goal of the methods is modelling, prediction, classification, dimensionality reduction, structure discovery and visualization. The performance of methods is evaluated by the computer-intensive techniques, like cross-validation. In this course we pay attention to assumptions and mathematical background of each method, enabling students to understand actual meaning of different choices and parameters used in the modelling process. The theoretical backgound of methods is discussed in lectures and practical skills of applying them are developed in computer labs by using R software.
description.et: Aine käsitleb statistilise analüüsi meetodeid, mida laias laastus jagatakse juhendatud ja juhendamata õppega meetoditeks. Kuigi paljud siia kuuluvad meetodid tulevad statistika ajaloost, on viimastel aastatel olulise panuse andnud arvutiteadlased oma algoritmiliste meetoditega. Meetodite eesmärgiks on modelleerimine, prognoosimine, klassifitseerimine, dimensiooni alandamine, struktuuri avastamine ja visualiseerimine. Meetodite headuse hindamiseks kasutatakse arvutiintensiivseid meetodeid, näiteks ristvalideerimist. Kursuses pööratakse suurt tähelepanu ka meetodite rakendamisel tehtavatele eeldustele ning taustaks olevatele matemaatilistele printsiipidele, andes kuulajatele võimaluse aru saada erinevate kasutatavate parameetrite sisulisest tähendusest.

objectives.en: Introduction to modern methods for analysing large datasets, the mathematical background of each method and learning to apply those methods by using R software.
objectives.et: Tutvumine kaasaegsete meetoditega suurte andmekogude analüüsimiseks, nende meetodite matemaatiliste tööprintsiipidega ning rakendamisvõimalustega R tarkvara baasil.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course, students know main machine learning methods (except neural networks), is able to choose most meaningful methods based on the aim of data analysis, is able to apply the methods for analyzing various datasets in R and is also able to interpret the results.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinu tunneb põhilisi masinõpe meetodeid (peale närvivõrkude) ja nende matemaatilist tausta, oskab lähtuvalt eesmärgist valida sobiva meetodi, seda rakendada R tarkvara kasutades ning saadavaid tulemusi interpreteerida.

independent_work.et: There are 8 homework assignments at 1st, 3rd,...,15th week. Instructions about completing the assignments are given on lab handouts or in Moodle

description.et: See "To obtain final grade"

grade_preconditions.et: In order to qualify for the final exam, at least 20 points (50%) for homework assignments is required

grade_evaluation.et: 60% of the final score is given by the final exam, 40% comes from the homework assignments. The final exam consists of a theoretical part (questions testing conceptual understanding of the course material) and a computational part (choosing and applying suitable methods for answering questions about given datasets)

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.en: Introduction. What is statistical learning? What is the role of statistics in Machine Learning? How to evaluate quality of the model? Statistical model fitting vs minimisation of a loss function
description.et: Sissejuhatus. Mis on tehisõpe? Milline on statistika roll tehisõppes? Kuidas hinnata mudeli headust? Statistilise mudeli sobitamine vs kaofunktsiooni minimiseerimine
